title: fanoutqa: Which teams have won NBA championships in the past five years? (ebe557cd696ab6ea)

chat_history.content: Which teams have won NBA championships in the past five years?
Let me help you look up the NBA championship winners from the past 5 years.

function.name: delegate
function.arguments: {"instructions": "Please look up and tell me which NBA teams won the championship in each year from 2019 to 2023."}

chat_history.content:
I'll help you look up the NBA champions for those recent years. Let me search for this information.


Let me search for the List of NBA champions to get this information.


Based on the search results, here are the NBA champions from 2019 to 2023:

2019: Toronto Raptors
2020: Los Angeles Lakers
2021: Milwaukee Bucks
2022: Golden State Warriors
2023: Denver Nuggets

It's worth noting that the 2020 championship was unique as it was won during the NBA "bubble" tournament due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with games being played in Orlando, Florida, in a controlled environment. The Denver Nuggets' 2023 championship was their first NBA title in franchise history.
chat_history.name: delegate

chat_history.content:
Here are the NBA champions from the past 5 years (2019-2023):

1. 2023: Denver Nuggets
2. 2022: Golden State Warriors
3. 2021: Milwaukee Bucks
4. 2020: Los Angeles Lakers
5. 2019: Toronto Raptors

Interestingly, each of these five championships was won by a different team, showing good competitive balance in the league during this period. The 2020 championship was notably won by the Lakers during the unique "bubble" tournament due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and the 2023 championship marked the Denver Nuggets' first NBA title in their franchise history.

Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

The current home-and-away format in the NBA Finals is 2–2–1–1–1 (the team with the better regular-season record plays on its home court in Games 1, 2, 5, and 7), which has been used in 1947–1948,[5] 1950–1952,[6][7][8] 1957–1970, 1972–1974, 1976–1977, 1979–1984, and 2014–present. It was previously in a 2–3–2 format (the team with the better regular season record plays on its home court in Games 1, 2, 6, and 7) during 1949, 1953–1955, and 1985–2013,[9][10] in a 1–1–1–1–1–1–1 format during 1956 and 1971,[11][12] and in a 1–2–2–1–1 format during 1975 and 1978.[13][14]


As of 2023[update], the Eastern champions have a 40–37 advantage in NBA titles over the Western champions, with their most recent being the Milwaukee Bucks in 2021.[15][*better source needed*] The Boston Celtics and the Minneapolis/Los Angeles Lakers have won a combined total of 34 NBA championships, with 17 apiece in their rivalry.[16] As of 2023[update], the defending champions are the Denver Nuggets.

<fragment>
The NBA Finals is the championship series for the National Basketball Association (NBA) held at the conclusion of its postseason. All Finals have been played in a best-of-seven format, and are contested between the winners of the Eastern Conference and the Western Conference (formerly Divisions before 1970), except in 1950 when the Eastern Division champion faced the winner between the Western and Central Division champions. From 1946 through 1949, when the league was known as the Basketball Association of America (BAA), the playoffs were a three-stage tournament where the two semifinal winners played each other in the finals.[1][2][3] The winning team of the series receives the Larry O'Brien Championship Trophy, which is awarded since 1977 (between 1947 and 1976 the winning team received the Walter A. Brown Trophy.[4]

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Based on the search results, here are the NBA champions from 2019 to 2023:

2019: Toronto Raptors
2020: Los Angeles Lakers
2021: Milwaukee Bucks
2022: Golden State Warriors
2023: Denver Nuggets

It's worth noting that the 2020 championship was unique as it was won during the NBA "bubble" tournament due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with games being played in Orlando, Florida, in a controlled environment. The Denver Nuggets' 2023 championship was their first NBA title in franchise history.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
